channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: More than 2.8 million people worldwide have tested positive for COVID-19 since the start of the outbreak, and overnight the number of coronavirus deaths in the United Kingdom passed 20,000.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Man in his 90s becomes Victoria's 17th COVID-19 death

item.description: Former St Kilda forward Arryn Siposs was snapped up by Detroit after a disappointing draft for Aussie prospects.
item.title: Ex-AFL player Siposs signed as punter by NFL's Lions

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 2.8 million as Australia’s death toll stands at 81

item.description: Arsenal will re-open their training ground to their players next week for individual training but the Premier League club will continue to observe social distancing rules amid the coronavirus outbreak.
item.title: Arsenal to re-open training to players

item.description: The peaceful protest of about 100 people had been held outside the presidential palace and military headquarters.
item.title: Indonesia convicts Papua activists of treason

item.description: Joe Ingles initially thought it would be a "two or three week" pause on the NBA season. Now he is beginning to think it will be lost.
item.title: Ingles thinks NBA season may be cancelled

item.description: The Premier has been urged to allow the senior students to return so they're not disadvantaged compared to their interstate counterparts.
item.title: Queensland private schools want Year 11 and 12 students to return immediately

item.description: The United Nations agency warned governments against issuing "immunity passports" or "risk-free certificates" to people who have been infected.
item.title: 'No evidence' recovered COVID-19 patients are immune, warns WHO

item.description: Overnight rain didn't stop Vanuatu from producing a rarity in these coronavirus- restricted times – a live sporting event.
item.title: Vanuatu cricket goes live across the globe

item.description: The musician and businessman had accused the financial magazine of "snubbing" him and being "disrespectful".
item.title: 'I am a billionaire': Kanye West wins wealth row with Forbes

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The Detroit Lions have signed former AFL forward Arryn Siposs, with the former Saint thrown a lifeline after missing out on selection in the NFL draft.
item.title: Siposs signed by Detroit after Australian punters suffer NFL draft snub

item.description: The English Premier League footballers won't be asked to contribute to the club financially during the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Full freight: Chelsea's stars not taking pay cuts

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The $450 million redevelopment proposal includes two towers, an open-air plaza, and new traffic arrangements.
item.title: 'An entirely new streetscape': LA-inspired complex to reshape Toowong

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The Prime Minister will confront a series of urgent decisions, including whether the United Kingdom's lockdown should be eased.
item.title: Boris Johnson announces return to work as Britain's COVID-19 toll passes 20,000

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald / The Age / Financial Review photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week, April 23, 2020

item.description: The nineteen-year-old Sydneysider is aiming to follow in the footsteps of cousin Thon Maker.
item.title: Giant Australian prospect Maker enters NBA draft

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Mr Barilaro, who has long been linked to the federal seat of Eden-Monaro, said he is open to the idea.
item.title: NSW Deputy Premier John Barilaro considers a tilt at federal politics

item.dc:creator: Gary Adshead
item.description: A letter recommending John McKechnie be reappointed as the Corruption and Crime Commission’s chief cited a need for "continuity" in the crucial role.
item.title: Leaked letter from WA Chief Justice to Premier cites need for 'continuity' in CCC post

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Curtin University is advertising for world-leading science and engineering academics, but there is one catch: only women are welcome to apply.
item.title: Curtin University needs science and engineering academics, but men need not apply

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The boys, aged 15 and 16, are accused of stealing three cars, including that of a Toowoomba couple marking Anzac Day on their driveway.
item.title: 'Brazen daylight robbery': Four teens charged over Anzac Day crime spree

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The pair, who both have medical conditions, have been missing in the south-east since Saturday.
item.title: Separate searches launched for two missing Queensland men

item.description: The report was eventually released with some criticism of the Chinese government rearranged or removed.
item.title: 'Very angry': China pressured EU to drop COVID disinformation criticism

item.description: The boy and the 27-year-old woman were both in a stable condition in hospital.
item.title: Man charged with stabbing boy and woman

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: After little movement for decades towards making work truly family friendly, the sudden shift to working from home due to COVID-19 has "mainstreamed" it.
item.title: 'Magical moments': How COVID-19 will super-charge family friendly work for good

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: Insiders are outraged over how the cluster linked to a private psychiatric clinic in Melbourne was handled.
item.title: Families and doctors blast 'lack of transparency' over COVID-19 outbreak

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Australia's success at limiting the spread of coronavirus is triumph for us all, but now our unity is being tested.
item.title: Only way to freedom is to follow the leader

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: It’s possible the extraordinary measures made necessary by the epidemic will result in lasting changes to the way households operate.
item.title: There's a silver lining for fathers in the COVID crisis

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: Psychologists, sociologists, historians and parents are trying to understand exactly what lasting impacts the times of COVID-19 will have on childhood.
item.title: 'We've gone back several decades': What will the legacy of lockdown be for kids?

item.description: The economic and learning benefits of a staged re-opening for all students are likely to be significantly greater than the alternatives.
item.title: As long as it's done right, a staged return to school makes good sense

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: What can we learn from the killer plagues of history? Why do outbreaks keep happening? And how might COVID-19 end?
item.title: Speckled monsters and graverobbers: how did past pandemics end and how does this one compare?

item.description: By writing out the role of the media and refugee advocates, the series does a disservice to those who worked to draw attention to those stranded in detention.
item.title: Questions the TV series 'Stateless' left unanswered

item.description: The young and less well off have been disproportionately affected by the economic shutdown. It's time for older, wealthier Australians to return the favour.
item.title: New rules: An aftermath of austerity will kill Australians too

item.description: As we find ourselves confined to our homes, with the way we move, work and go about our daily lives radically altered, it is time to ask which changes will endure beyond the pandemic.
item.title: What do we want life in Melbourne to look like on the other side?

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Rugby Australia called in extra security and conducted an audit of the CEO's house after she received a death threat from an Israel Folau supporter last year.
item.title: RA feared for Castle after death threat at height of Folau scandal

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: More than $15 million will help struggling arts organisations such as the Comedy Festival, La Mama Theatre and Heide Museum pay the bills under lockdown.
item.title: Cash 'down payment' to rescue Victoria's devastated arts sector

item.description: Barnaby Joyce’s stated intention to refuse to download the virus app should make people more inclined to agree to accept it.
item.title: App should not be a matter of Joyce

item.description: The finest photos from the wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: High-profile orthopaedic surgeon Munjed Al Muderis supervised the operations in mid-April at Macquarie University Hospital.
item.title: Private hospital defends hip and knee replacements during elective surgery ban

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: A localised outbreak of COVID-19 has hit the Blue Mountains west of Sydney, as the state recorded 12 new cases.
item.title: Virus cluster hits Blue Mountains as state government announces economic stimulus

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: IVF clinics are fielding calls from patients desperate to restart their fertility treatment after the federal government lifted its ban on elective surgery, but not everyone will be able to book in when the industry restarts next week.
item.title: Fertility patients eager to restart IVF treatment when ban lifts

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: "Schools are among the safest places that we have," said lead investigator Professor Kristine Macartney.
item.title: Safe as houses: COVID-19 study clears NSW schools for student return

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: One of the former first daughters remains in the US amid the ongoing global pandemic.
item.title: Tony Abbott's daughter living in coronavirus epicentre

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Lawyers warn many more fines could be cancelled by the courts if people challenge their infringements.
item.title: Police commissioner personally cancels 32 out of 1000 coronavirus fines

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: On all available evidence, children do not seem to be major spreaders of this virus. They need to be back at school for their own good - and that's where the nation needs them.
item.title: The schools debate is a bonfire of pre-existing passions. Children are poorly served by it

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: You don’t trust the government, you say? Get over it!
item.title: I'm a COVID tracing app convert (Barnaby, you brought me to my senses)

item.dc:creator: Michael Koziol
item.description: Mobility data from Apple shows a small rise in the number of people searching for directions by road, foot and public transport.
item.title: Experts warn against creeping complacency as travel ticks up and businesses reopen

item.description: The number of Australians adopting and fostering pets since the COVID-19 restrictions were put in place have exploded.
item.title: They've wanted a dog for years. Lockdown has finally made it happen.

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Patricia Zammit worked at Ansett for 17 years before it collapsed in 2001. She had reached 17 years at Virgin when it fell into administration.
item.title: When the skies close in on your career - again

item.dc:creator: Kathy Lette
item.description: Generally speaking, it’s true that the enlistment of labour on a subsistence basis is now forbidden except in one state - the holy state of matrimony.
item.title: It seems a woman’s work is never done … not by men anyway
